moves.1. e4: this is my most common move. d4 I used to play a lot, but now I rarely use it.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5: I swear, this is the last time I am ever going to play the ruy lopez. I hate the theory, and it's just not my type of opening.
moves.4. O-O Bd7 5. Nc3 g6 6. d4: There is the saying:flank advances should be met by center counters. g6 is not a threat, but I figure opening the position can't hurt me.
moves.10. f4: I know that most inexperienced players think that pawn structure is very critical, which is untrue. The order of advantages from the highest to least in a position evaluation are: material, piece activity, king safety, and finally pawn structure. Also, here, if he takes, I get an open b file and get to exploit the weak dark squares easily. If his king castle on either side, I will have play against it.
moves.10... Bxc3: it was probably better to keep the bishop to watch the dark squares.
moves.11. bxc3 O-O-O: well, now I can't exploit the dark squares, but my b file gives play against the king.
moves.13... Qc6 14. Qd4 b6: pointless. better is to get his pieces out safely.
moves.15. Kh1: I forgot why I played this. It seems like a very slow move, but I think I was paranoid of Qc5.
moves.15... Qd7: the queen is moving back and forth without any clear plan.
moves.16... Qe6: too many queen moves!! The knight and rook are not doing anything.
moves.17. f5: open the position when you have better development.
moves.18. Rab1: trade is fine for me. I am experienced at handling small material advantages (not so great at generating unclear attacks) and a trade is fine, as it will undouble the pawns and leave my pieces relatively better. I will also, of course have 1 extra pawn.
moves.18... Ne7 19. Qc4: threatening Bxb6, and he will have to really do something about this. This also sets a little trap, which black can blunder into if he over reacts
moves.19... Kb7: totally over reacting.  What do you think I played now??
moves.20. Bxb6: Bxb6! anyways! The bishop is immune(not really,because black getting mated and can do whatever he wants), and black should resign, as he is another pawn down and will be mated.
moves.21... Kxb6 22. Rb1+: this is like a two rooks mate (queen is fine too), with the king cornered to the edge of the board
